name: Titeuf: Méga compet'
description:
Titeuf: Méga compet' is a French collection of mini-games based on the comic book series Titeuf. The GBA version is in 2D and is completely different from the 3D Titeuf: Méga compet' game for PS2 and Windows. After seeing a program about cloning on television, Titeuf and his classmates are worried they will be cloned as well. They participate in different activities to prevent this from happening.

After each activity points can be earned in three categories: méga bisou, méga style and méga bêtise. The environment of the school acts as the main hub. It it shown through a top-down view and a star can be moved to scroll and select an activity. There are various mini-games. In one Titeuf is positioned on a window up high and he needs to pee on his classmates without hitting any passing adults. The player has to direct the stream. Another one shows him from a top-down view running in the park. He needs to hit his friends with a water gun before time runs out, also avoiding adults. The gun regularly needs to be refilled at the fountain. In another Titeuf needs to select a cool magazine at the newsagent's and avoid bad ones. At school he needs to undress a woman in a picture as quickly as possible by picking the next item of clothing to remove out of three options before time runs out.

The game uses a calendar system for a school week and a certain amount of points need to be earned before the week is over. Through a cell phone in the top left corner text messages can be received. Titeuf can reply, choosing from different options, to send gag texts. Next to the main single-player mode there is the méga compet' mode where various mini-games can be accessed directly. In this mode up to two players are supported. An example is a vertical split-screen running game where the characters need to jump over obstacles.
